definitions.definition: a person whose job involves designing and building engines, machines, roads, bridges, etc.

examples.text: We worked with a team of scientists and engineers.
You need the advice of a qualified engineer.
engineers who designed and built advanced military aircraft

definitions.definition: a person who is trained to repair machines and electrical equipment

examples.text: They're sending an engineer to fix the problem with the heating.
We were on the phone with a technical support engineer.

definitions.definition: a person whose job is to control and repair engines, especially on a ship or an aircraft

examples.text: the chief engineer on a cruise liner

definitions.definition: a person whose job is driving a railway engine
a soldier trained to design and build military structures

wordOrigin: Middle English (denoting a designer and constructor of fortifications and weapons; formerly also as ingineer): in early use from Old French engigneor, from medieval Latin ingeniator, from ingeniare ‘contrive, devise’, from Latin ingenium ‘talent, device’, from in- ‘in’ + gignere ‘beget’; in later use from French ingénieur or Italian ingegnere, also based on Latin ingenium, with the ending influenced by -eer.
